title: Auto-rickshaw driver, vegetable vendor found dead in Sylhet, Habiganj
body: Two people, including a CNG-run auto-rickshaw driver and a vegetable vendor, were found dead in Sylhet and Habiganj on Sunday morning. The deceased are Shipan Ahmad, 25, an auto-rickshaw driver, son of Ashraf Ali of Raikdara village at Dayamir union under Osmani Nagar upazila in Sylhet, and Jitu Miah, 48, son of late Maurash Miah of Sataihal village at Gaznaipur union under Nabiganj upazila in Habiganj, police said. Family members of Shipan told reporters that he did not return home after going out with the auto-rickshaw at about 8:00pm Saturday and his mobile phone was found switched off at 10:00pm. Osmani Nagar police station officer-in-charge Morshedul Hasan Bhuiyan told New Age that they recovered the throat-slit body of the victim from Sadaipur area at about 9:00am Sunday after being informed by the locals. ‘He might have been killed so that his auto-rickshaw could be snatched,’ he said, adding that the body was sent to Sylhet Osmani Medical College Hospital for post-mortem examination. Meanwhile, In Nabiganj upazila of Habiganj, police recovered the body of Jitu Miah from a cropland near Janatar Bazar of Gaznaipur union on Sunday morning. Locals said that Jitu Miah used to sell vegetables at Janatar Bazar, he went out of his shop Saturday evening, leaving his son in the shop, and since then he had been missing. Nabiganj police station officer-in-charge Md Monayem Miah told New Age that they recovered his body at about 9:00am Sunday after being informed by the locals and sent it to Habiganj Sadar Adhunik Hospital for post-mortem examination. ‘Efforts are under way to identify the reason and men behind the death,’ he added.
